docs.title: What is MCP Bridge?
docs.text:
MCP Bridge enables Claude.ai (the web interface) to communicate with local Model Context Protocol servers — giving Claude access to your filesystem, databases, APIs, and custom tools.

┌─────────────┐     SSE      ┌─────────────┐    stdio    ┌─────────────┐
│  Claude.ai  │ ←──────────→ │  SSE Bridge │ ←─────────→ │  MCP Server │
│  Extension  │              │   (local)   │             │  (fs, db..) │
└─────────────┘              └─────────────┘             └─────────────┘

docs.text: Feature Description 🔌 Zero Config Auto-discovers MCP servers from Claude Desktop config 🔒 Local Only All communication stays on localhost ⚡ Fast SSE streaming for real-time responses 🛠️ Extensible Works with any stdio-based MCP server

docs.title: ✅ CORRECT Setup for Claude MCP Browser Extension
The Issue We Found
docs.text:
The extension needs an SSE (Server-Sent Events) URL, not just command-based configs.

I've created an SSE Bridge Server that solves this!

docs.title: 🎯 Step 1: Start the SSE Bridge Server
docs.text:
The SSE bridge is already running! To start it manually:

# Start the bridge server
cd ~/projects/dev-tools/mcp-sse-bridge
node server.js

# Keep this terminal open!

The server runs on: http://localhost:3000

docs.title: 📝 Step 2: Configure Extension with CORRECT URLs
docs.text: Now update your extension servers to use the SSE bridge:

docs.title: Server 1: Filesystem
docs.text:
Name:     filesystem
URL:      http://localhost:3000/sse        ← CORRECT URL!
Command:  npx
Arguments: (click + Add for each)
  -y
  @modelcontextprotocol/server-filesystem
  /Users/dt
Env Vars: (none)

docs.title: Server 2: Shell
docs.text:
Name:     shell
URL:      http://localhost:3000/sse        ← CORRECT URL!
Command:  node
Arguments: (click + Add)
  /Users/dt/projects/dev-tools/shell-mcp-server/index.js
Env Vars: (none)

docs.title: Server 3: Statistical Research
docs.text:
Name:     statistical-research
URL:      http://localhost:3000/sse        ← CORRECT URL!
Command:  bun
Arguments: (click + Add for each)
  run
  /Users/dt/projects/dev-tools/claude-statistical-research/mcp-server/src/index.ts
Env Vars: (click Show)
  Key: R_LIBS_USER
  Value: ~/R/library

docs.title: ✅ Step 3: Test It!
docs.text:
1. Delete old "filesystem" server in extension (if URL was "local")
  2. Add new "filesystem" server with URL http://localhost:3000/sse
  3. Refresh claude.ai page
  4. Test: Read the file at /Users/dt/test-mcp-filesystem.txt

docs.title: 🔧 How It Works
docs.text:
┌─────────────────┐
│  claude.ai      │  Browser
│  + Extension    │
└────────┬────────┘
         │ SSE (HTTP)
         ↓
┌─────────────────┐
│  SSE Bridge     │  localhost:3000
│  (Node server)  │
└────────┬────────┘
         │ stdio
         ↓
┌─────────────────┐
│  MCP Server     │  Your local tools
│  (npx/node/bun) │
└─────────────────┘

The SSE bridge translates between: - Browser (HTTP/SSE) ↔ MCP Servers (stdio)

docs.title: 🚀 Auto-Start the Bridge (Optional)
docs.text:
To start the bridge automatically:

# Create a launch script
cat > ~/projects/dev-tools/mcp-sse-bridge/start.sh << 'EOF'
#!/bin/bash
cd ~/projects/dev-tools/mcp-sse-bridge
node server.js
EOF

chmod +x ~/projects/dev-tools/mcp-sse-bridge/start.sh

# Run it:
~/projects/dev-tools/mcp-sse-bridge/start.sh

Or add to your startup items (System Preferences → Users & Groups → Login Items).

docs.title: Server Configuration
docs.text: Configure MCP servers for the bridge to spawn and connect to.

docs.title: Configuration File
docs.text: The bridge reads from ~/.config/claude/claude_desktop_config.json (same as Claude Desktop).

docs.title: Basic Structure
docs.text:
{
  "mcpServers": {
    "server-name": {
      "command": "executable",
      "args": ["arg1", "arg2"],
      "env": {
        "KEY": "value"
      }
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Filesystem Server
docs.text:
Access local files and directories:

{
  "mcpServers": {
    "filesystem": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": [
        "-y",
        "@anthropic/mcp-filesystem-server",
        "/Users/me/projects",
        "/Users/me/documents"
      ]
    }
  }
}

docs.title: SQLite Database
docs.text:
Query SQLite databases:

{
  "mcpServers": {
    "sqlite": {
      "command": "npx",
      "args": [
        "-y",
        "@anthropic/mcp-sqlite-server",
        "--db-path",
        "/path/to/database.db"
      ]
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Custom Server
docs.text:
Run your own MCP server:

{
  "mcpServers": {
    "my-server": {
      "command": "node",
      "args": ["/path/to/my-server.js"],
      "env": {
        "API_KEY": "secret"
      }
    }
  }
}

docs.title: Bridge-Specific Config
docs.text:
The bridge also reads packages/server/config.json for its own settings:

{
  "port": 8080,
  "host": "localhost"
}

docs.title: Verify Configuration
docs.text:
After editing config, restart the bridge server:

# Stop current server (Ctrl+C)
pnpm server

Check the logs for discovered servers:

Found MCP servers: filesystem, sqlite

Security

The bridge runs MCP servers with your user permissions. Only add servers you trust.

docs.title: Issue: "Cannot access local filesystem" on claude.ai
docs.text: This means the MCP extension isn't connecting properly.

docs.title: Quick Checks:
docs.text:
1. Extension Loaded?
  2. Go to chrome://extensions/
  3. Find "claude-tools" or similar
  4. Should show "Enabled"

  5. Check for any errors under the extension

  6. On claude.ai page?

  7. Extension ONLY works on claude.ai
  8. Won't work on other websites

  9. Refresh the page (Cmd+R)

  10. Extension Icon Visible?

  11. Should see icon in Chrome toolbar
  12. Click it when on claude.ai

  13. Should show server list

  14. Server Configuration?

  15. Click extension icon → Should see "filesystem" server
  16. Check the settings match: 
    Name: filesystem
URL: local
Command: npx
Args: -y, @modelcontextprotocol/..., /Users/dt

docs.title: 1. Check Extension Console
docs.text:
1. Right-click extension icon
2. Click "Inspect popup"
3. Look for errors in Console tab
4. Common errors:
   - "Command not found" → npx not in PATH
   - "Connection failed" → Server didn't start
   - "Timeout" → Server taking too long

docs.text:

npx -y @modelcontextprotocol/server-filesystem /Users/dt

# Press Ctrl+C to stop

docs.text:

2. Go to Console tab
3. Look for MCP-related messages
4. Check Network tab for SSE connections

docs.text:
1. Go to chrome://extensions/
2. Find the extension
3. Click reload icon (circular arrow)
4. Refresh claude.ai page

docs.title: Issue 1: "npx: command not found"
docs.text:
Solution: Install Node.js/npm 

# Check if npx exists:
which npx

# If not found, install Node.js:
brew install node

docs.title: Issue 2: Server starts but doesn't connect
docs.text: Solution: Check the URL field - Should be: local or similar placeholder - NOT empty - NOT a real URL like http://...

docs.title: Issue 3: Extension icon shows but no servers
docs.text: Solution: Server wasn't saved properly - Delete and re-add the server - Make sure all fields are filled - Click "Add" (not Cancel)

docs.title: Issue 4: Works in popup but not in chat
docs.text: Solution: Refresh claude.ai page - The extension injects code into the page - Needs page refresh after adding servers
